pages.text: $(n)There are a few ways to enchant items:$() $(li)Through an $(item)Enchanting Table$() in exchange for experience points and $(item)Lapis Lazuli$(). Only unenchanted items may be enchanted this way. $(li)Through an $(item)Anvil$(), combining an $(item)Enchanted Book$() with an item. $(li)Through an $(item)Anvil$(), combining two of the same item with different existing enchantments into a single item that has the enchantments of both. $(li)Through a librarian $(thing)Villager$(), which may enchant $(item)Books$() respectively for emeralds instead of $(item)Lapis Lazuli$() and experience.

An item can be enchanted by using an $(item)Enchanting Table$() and placing the item in the input slots and 1â€“3 $(item)Lapis Lazuli$() in its dedicated slot. Upon placing the item, three randomized enchanting options appear on the right.

pages.title: Increasing the level
pages.text: To increase the enchantment level, $(item)Bookshelves$() can be placed next to the $(item)Enchanting Table$() while keeping one block of air between them. $(br2)The only choices available have a level requirement equal to or below the player's current level and a $(item)Lapis Lazuli$() requirement equal to or below the number of lapis placed in the table.
